newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico futures market set to start Oct. 20 - BMV.
newsitem.headline: Mexico futures market set to start Oct. 20 - BMV.

text.p: Mexican financial authorities said on Wednesday they plan to begin operations at a new derivatives market by October 20, which will list stock market, bond and foreign exchange futures.
"The target date has yet to be ratified," Bernardo Gonzalez, associate director general of derivatives at the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV), said at a news conference.
The market will be officially created at a September meeting, Gonzalez added.
Membership of the Mexican Derivatives Market (Mexder) will be open to financial and non-financial companies, subject to their acquiring a minimum of one share each in the market.
BMV authorities said they see the first stage of futures trading through open outcry and based on the Mexican bourse's blue chip IPC index, 91-day Cetes (treasury bonds) and the Mexican peso.
